list_definition.definition: to go along with a hop on each foot in turn

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The little girl skipped up the path.

list_definition.definition: to jump over a rope that is being turned under the feet and over the head (as a children’s game).
to miss out (a meal, part of a book etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I skipped lunch and went shopping instead

list_ex_of_english: Newspapers can afford to offer stories with limited appeal, since uninterested consumers can simply skip them.
